title: A Textural Backyard Wonderland For A Preston Family Home
description: You wouldn’t know by looking at it now, but this enchanting Preston garden used to be a barren block, with concrete and ‘terrible soil and weeds.’ In short, it was a blank canvas for landscape designer and director of Mcnuttndorff Landscapes, Lori McNutt, to create something magical. See how she transformed the space into a wonderland of natives, perennials and textural, shifting plants below.
author: The Design Files
